summary: The Niagara Falls Water Board is soliciting proposals from qualified engineering consultants to perform Phase 1 sanitary sewer evaluation survey (SSES) services in designated LaSalle area sewersheds, produce an engineering report and corrective action plan acceptable to NYSDEC, and conduct post-construction monitoring, with optional pricing for similar services for Phases 2 and 3.

requirements.description: Provide professional engineering services to perform Phase 1 SSES in the 91st & Luick and 81st & Frontier 1 sewersheds, including investigation, analysis, reporting, and post-construction monitoring.
Include option prices, schedules, and scopes to perform SSES for Phase 2 (81st & Frontier 2 and 80th & Lindbergh sewersheds) and Phase 3 (Mang & 88th sewershed).
Comply with NYSDEC and EPG requirements, including the Engineering Report Outline for NYS Wastewater Infrastructure Projects dated October 1, 2022.
Attend the mandatory pre-proposal information session at the Wastewater Treatment Plant on November 29, 2022 at noon.
Submit any written questions to the authorized Water Board contact by the stated deadline (November 30, 2022 at 3:00 p.m.).
Designate a Project Manager as the primary contact for the project and provide project management and support throughout the engagement.
Review existing data, records, reports, the Order on Consent, and NYSDEC correspondence related to LaSalle SSO abatement.
Gain familiarity with Phase 1 sewersheds, including system context, history of I&I reduction, repairs, maintenance, and flow management procedures (including SCADA control on lift stations).
Meet with Water Board staff to discuss scope, obtain input on system response and locations for flow isolation and measurement, and provide professional advice during the term.
Coordinate and meet with NFWB staff and NYSDEC as needed to reach consensus on work to be performed and to discuss results and corrective action recommendations.

Perform smoke testing in Phase 1 sewersheds, providing all staff, equipment, and materials, ensuring appropriate weather conditions, advance resident notification (2–4 days), coordination with police and fire, and documentation/photography of defects.

Perform night-time flow isolation and measurement (weiring), including review of prior flow data, selection of adequate weir locations, provision of staff/equipment/traffic control, confined space entry capability, resident notification, and analysis of infiltration in gpd per linear foot for each section.

Review and analyze existing CCTV inspection reports and manhole inspection reports (NASSCO PACP), perform additional data collection as needed, meet with NFWB on repairs completed since inspections, and use NFWB crews for any additional CCTV imaging of mains.

Perform Outfall/SSO condition assessment for the two Phase 1 outfalls (91st & Luick and 81st & Frontier 1), including review of NFWB data, site visits, development of an assessment Work Plan (potentially including meters, gauges, confined space/dye testing, CCTV coordination), execution upon authorization, GIS-compatible documentation, and recommendations to reduce extraneous flows.

Plan for and potentially conduct focused SSES activities (dye testing, house inspections, additional CCTV by NFWB crews) in areas identified as I&I sources, using a $10,000 contingency budget only upon NFWB approval.

Prepare an SSES report for Phase 1 acceptable to NYSDEC that identifies I&I sources and provides a corrective action plan prioritizing cost-effective flow reduction alternatives, including budgetary cost estimates and implementation timelines.
Complete the SSES report in time to allow NYSDEC review early in 2023 to support construction of recommended improvements in 2023–early 2024 and post-construction monitoring by June 2024.
Ensure the SSES report is prepared, stamped, and dated by a New York State licensed Professional Engineer and conforms to the NYS Engineering Report Outline (October 1, 2022).

Conduct post-construction monitoring in Phase 1 sewersheds in 2024, including I&I assessment of pre- and post-construction flow and rainfall monitoring, and prepare a Post-Construction I&I Assessment and Cost Analysis Report for NYSDEC documenting I&I reduction and most effective techniques.

Include in the proposal: situation understanding; understanding of applicable regulations and standards; project approach, scope, and organization; demonstrated experience on similar projects; experience and qualifications of subconsultants/contractors; specific experience of key project professionals; and schedule, effort, and budget breakdown with not-to-exceed fee and $10,000 contingency for Task 6.
Provide schedules in bar chart form and effort/budget in a spreadsheet using a task/hour estimate matrix, including not-to-exceed fee amount.
For Option 1 (Phase 2), propose scope, schedule, and fees to perform all applicable SSES tasks except Task 5 (no outfall/SSO locations).
For Option 2 (Phase 3), propose scope, schedule, and fees to perform all applicable SSES tasks, including Outfall/SSO assessment for one outfall.
Complete all forms in Appendix E (Standard Terms, Conditions, and Requirements) and submit them with the proposal, including required certifications and acknowledgments.

Comply with Mandatory State Financial Assistance Terms and Conditions for Contracts Funded with NYS Financial Assistance (Appendix F), including EEO Staffing Plan, Workforce Employment Utilization Report, and meeting MWBE (30% combined) and SDVOB (6%) participation goals.
Submit MWBE and SDVOB utilization plans or properly completed waiver requests with the proposal and, if awarded, prior to contract execution; comply with monthly MWBE-SDVOB reporting requirements.

Submit a comprehensive statement of qualifications including business structure, licensing, years in business, similar experience with references, locations, key personnel, other business names, subsidiaries/parents, disclosure of debarment/default/bankruptcy/legal actions, conflicts of interest, and details for any subcontractors performing more than 10% of the work.
Accept and comply with general RFP conditions including Water Board rights to reject, modify, negotiate, and award; proposals must be firm and irrevocable for 90 days from submission deadline.
Identify any exceptions to RFP terms in a separate attachment titled “Exceptions”; unlisted exceptions are waived.
Direct all inquiries regarding the RFP via email to the authorized Water Board contact by the specified deadline; acknowledge receipt of all addenda on Appendix E Form No. 1.

Submit proposal package by the deadline: one clearly marked original and six copies, plus one electronic copy on CD or USB in a single PDF or clearly ordered files; include original signed appendices only in paper original; seal and label outer envelope with contact name, proposer info, and RFP number/title.
Provide adequate and competent personnel with necessary licensing, education, training, and experience; comply with credentialing, security, safety, and other Water Board requirements.

Procure and maintain required insurance (workers compensation, disability, employer’s liability, CGL, auto, umbrella/excess, professional liability) with specified limits, naming NFWB, Niagara Falls Public Water Authority, and City of Niagara Falls as additional insureds, and provide certificates and endorsements with 30 days’ notice of change/cancellation.
Agree to indemnification and waiver of subrogation in favor of NFWB and related entities for damages arising from contractor actions/inactions.

Develop and, if requested, submit a Safety Program and Site-Specific Health & Safety Plan covering hazards, procedures, PPE, OSHA training, and monitoring, and ensure compliance with OSHA and all safety regulations.
Operate as an independent contractor, identify subcontractors in proposal, accept Water Board right to reject subcontractors, and remain responsible for entire contract.

Maintain records for at least six years after the calendar year made; allow access for inspection/audit by State Comptroller, Attorney General, and NFWB; manage FOIL-sensitive information as specified.
Comply with NYS Information Security Breach and Notification laws and any applicable data security requirements.
Pay prevailing wages as required by law and submit Workforce Employment Utilization Reports if required; comply with MWBE/SDVOB reporting for payment.
Provide monthly invoices with sufficient supporting documentation; accept 60-day payment terms, subject to compliance with prevailing wage and MWBE/SDVOB reporting.
Acknowledge Water Board’s exemption from sales tax and exclude such taxes from pricing.
Comply with non-discrimination and sexual harassment prevention requirements; submit EEO Policy Statement (Appendix E Form No. 4) and Statement on Sexual Harassment (Form No. 5).
Certify compliance with Iran Divestment Act, International Boycott Prohibition, MacBride Fair Employment Principles, and prohibition on purchase of tropical hardwoods, as applicable.
Disclose and avoid conflicts of interest; certify no improper payments or political/religious use of funds.
Submit Certificate of Non-Collusion (Appendix E Form No. 2).
Comply with NYS Lobbying Law (State Finance Law 139-j and 139-k) restrictions on contacts; submit Lobbying Law Disclosure Statement (Appendix E Form No. 3).
Acknowledge waiver of immunity provisions under Public Authorities Law §2875 as a condition of contract award.
Accept termination, governing law, venue, service of process, and non-waiver clauses as stated in Appendix E.
If selected, participate in possible informal interviews or presentations with NFWB staff or Board to discuss concepts and methods.

evaluation_criteria.description: Demonstrated understanding of the project context, LaSalle SSO issues, regulatory drivers, and specific needs of the Phase 1 sewersheds. (Page 8, Item 1, 20 points).
Relevant experience with similar SSES/I&I mitigation and NYSDEC/EPG-funded projects; qualifications of firm and key staff; ability to perform required tasks effectively. (Page 8, Item 2, 40 points).
Inclusion of all required sections, forms, MWBE/SDVOB plans, schedules, budgets, and options; responsiveness to all RFP requirements. (Page 8, Item 3, 20 points).
Overall cost competitiveness and clarity of not-to-exceed fee and task/hour matrix, including options for Phases 2 and 3. (Page 8, Item 4, 20 points).

submission_requirements.format: Sealed paper submission: 1 original + 6 copies, plus 1 electronic copy on CD or USB (PDF preferred), delivered to the authorized Water Board contact; envelope labeled with proposer name/address and RFP number/title.
sections_required: Understanding of applicable regulations and standards
Project approach, scope, and project organization
Specific experience of key project professionals
Effort and budget breakdown (task/hour matrix, not-to-exceed fee, $10,000 contingency for Task 6)
Statement of Qualifications as per Appendix E
Completed Appendix E forms (Addenda acknowledgment, Non-collusion, Lobbying Law disclosure, EEO policy, Sexual Harassment statement, RFP Acknowledgement & Certification)
MWBE and SDVOB utilization plans or waiver requests

key_differentiators: Demonstrated deep understanding of SSO/I&I dynamics in small sewersheds, NYSDEC’s R-value methodology, and the specific LaSalle Order on Consent context, with clear linkage to how the proposed approach will satisfy regulatory expectations and timelines.

Proven track record delivering SSES and I&I mitigation projects under NYSDEC oversight and EPG or similar grant-funded programs, including successful preparation of Engineering Reports conforming to the October 1, 2022 NYS outline.

Robust, clearly phased technical approach that goes beyond minimum tasks—for example, advanced data analytics, GIS integration, and risk-based prioritization of corrective actions to maximize cost-effective I&I reduction.

Strong project management plan with a detailed, realistic schedule that aligns SSES, reporting, design/bidding support, and post-construction monitoring to the aggressive 2023–2024 timeline, including contingency strategies for weather and access constraints.

Well-qualified, NY-licensed PE-led team with specialized expertise in flow monitoring, SSES field methods (smoke, dye, CCTV, weiring), SCADA-informed operations, and stakeholder communication (residents, police/fire, NYSDEC).
Comprehensive MWBE and SDVOB participation strategy that credibly meets or exceeds the 30% MWBE and 6% SDVOB goals, minimizing the need for waivers and reducing compliance risk for NFWB.

Clear, transparent cost proposal with a defensible task/hour matrix and value-adding efficiencies (e.g., leveraging existing data, minimizing field mobilizations) to provide competitive total cost while maintaining quality.

Thoughtful communication and risk management plan, including coordination with NFWB operations, clear protocols for resident notifications and safety, and proactive management of regulatory and schedule risks.
